narratives.question_text: If a requirement, did this course occur in proper sequence within the School's educational program?  If not, where should it occur?
Comment on the body of material presented and the content of the course: sequence, syllabus, and assignments.
comments: There was little content, the assignments were as expected for a course such as this with assignments due after the main studio course was over, the projects were under-ambitious and poor.

narratives.question_text: What were your expectations for this course and how well were they met?
comments: To make things, and we were allowed to. This course is what we should be allowed to do at architecture school.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the value of this course to you.
comments: I think it is very important to study affect and texture, etc.

I really dont think a course like this has a specific value, its simply important to do as an architect. To experiment, to make, to analyize, and to create. Sometimes one has a success, sometimes one has a failure. It was a wonderful course.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the effectiveness of the teaching by the courses's instructor
comments: Brennan often failed to give good advice or critique. Otherwise, he was all right.

The readings were great and the presentation by the guest from Roman& Williams great too. However, the "inner world" aspect to the course should have been emphasized more. The projects, almost by default, became object-like fabrication pieces rather than immersive environments.

narratives.question_text: Suggestions you may have for course improvements:
comments: The course should focus more on research toward the beginning of the semester. The one week of precedent material research was great; there should have bee more of that throughout the semester.
